author: Eirian Odalis

text: This part of the game is amazing. The placement of it is so perfect. I remember my first time fighting Master Belch, it went pretty horribly. I forgot about the Fly Honey, and I blew all my PP before I realized what I needed to do. I swear there were at least ten mini barfs by the time I realized. I remember having Ness and Jeff dead and just spamming pray over and over until I got the one that revived everything. It was a GOD SEND. I remember screaming I was so happy. I finally realized that I needed the Fly Honey and used it, but I was still really far behind. By the end of the fight, both Paula and Jeff were dead, and Ness was on, like, 15 HP. Ness got hit by one of the Mini Barfs, but I managed to get a super lucky crit on Belch which managed to finish him off right before Ness's HP finished scrolling down. My heart was pounding after that fight, and I swear to god, the coffee break felt so good. I'll admit I cried a little bit during this scene.

text:
You’ve traveled very far from home…

Do you remember how your long and winding journey began with someone pounding at your door? It was Pokey, the worst person in your neighborhood, who knocked on the door that fateful night.

On your way, you have walked, thought and fought. Yet through all this, you have never lost your courage. You have grown steadily stronger, though you have experienced the pain of battle many times.

You are no longer alone in your adventure, Paula who is steadfast, kind and even pretty, is always at your side. Jeff is with you as well. Though he is timid, he came from a distant land to help you. Ness, as you certainly know by now, you are not a regular young man… You have an awesome destiny to fulfill.

The journey from this point will be long, and it will be more difficult than anything you have undergone to this point. Yet, I know you will be all right. When good battles evil, which side do you believe wins? Do you have faith that good is triumphant?

One thing you must never lose is courage. If you believe in the goal you are striving for, you will be courageous. There are many difficult times ahead, but you must keep your sense of humor, work through the tough situations and enjoy yourself.

When you have finished this cup of coffee, your adventure will begin again. Next, you must pass through a vast desert and proceed to the big city of Fourside.

Ness…

           Paula…

                       Jeff…

I wish you luck…

text: Love that the game actively made you sit there for a moment and think about what you'd done so far. So often I think its taken for granted and the game is only concerned with getting you to the next set piece or plot point, but this game said nah, chill out for a second, thinking of all the bosses you've beaten, the towns you've visited, and listen to this cool tune.

text: i've come far from where i was when i made this comment i achieved one of the things that not only did my family want but i wanted too i graduated high school today now there will be some that say graduating high school is easy for me it wasn't it took me a long time to get here i had my doubts i was kicked down many times i wanted to give up but my family encouraged me every step of the way they told me that it doesn't matter when you get a diploma it's if you got one at all and this only the beginning i'll only keep going farther and farther till i reach success now to anyone that comes across this i say this if you have goals in life don't give up on them work hard to achieve them it will feel great and then grab yourself a nice cup of coffee or something nice to drink sit down  and recount what you did to get here sorry if this sounds like a mess of words

text: Imagine that you've been so caught up with work, school, relationships, chores, adulthood, etc.for months and you finally find yourself caught up with everything and have a moment of peace to reflect on how much you've grown and changed over such a short time. This is that moment. This is when you catch your breath and realize what you've become, what you've done, and the past is just the past now. After this, the only thing left is the future.

text: On the second stage performance of the Runaway 5, there is a 6th member that is bald wearing make-up and jewelry playing the keyboards.  On the ending credits, there is an entry something like assistant musical something or other, named Takayashi Ueno.  I'm not saying that that name doesn't exist in Japanese (I don't know either way or the other), but given the rest of the content of the game this could be a nom de plume (sp?) for Brian Eno in this case.  There is more evidence I could site..
